article:
A man and his girlfriend married. A few months later, the wife came to the husband with a   _  . "I read in a magazine about how we can   _   our marriage," she said. "Each of us will write a   _   of the things that we find a bit annoying to the other person. Then, we can talk about how we can   _   them together and make our life happier together. "
    The husband agreed.   _  , each of them began to think of the things that he or she felt slightly   _   with the other and wrote down what they   came up with  .
    The next morning, they decided that they would   _   their lists.
    "I'll   _  ," offered the wife. She took out her list. It had many   _   on it, enough to fill 3 pages. As she was   _   the list of the little annoyances  , she   _   that tears were starting to appear in her husband's eyes.
    "What's wrong?" she asked. "Nothing," the husband replied.
    The wife continued to read   _   she had read all three pages.
    "Now, it's your   _  ," she said.
    Quietly the husband said, "I don't have anything on my list. I think that you are   _   the way that you are. I don't wait you to   _   anything for me. "
    The wife,   _   by his honesty and the depth of his   _   for her and his acceptance of her, turned her head and wept.
    We have a world that is full of beauty, light and promise. Why waste time   looking for   the bad, the disappointing or the annoying now that we can see the   _   things before us?
